channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs and policies are putting America’s economy at risk: Consumer Technology Association CEO
item.description: Higher tariffs are already creating “cost shocks” for businesses, which for many will be passed on to consumers.

item.title: Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel wants to use AI to make it “easier for everybody to experience the world”
item.description: "We should be able to handle everything for you, so that from start to finish, from beginning to plan it out till the time you actually book," Booking...

item.title: From bartering ice cream for meals to a $125M business: How Jeni’s founder launched her sweet treat empire
item.description: Jeni Britton, founder of Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams, turned a $40,000 loan into a $125 million business.

item.title: The Boeing Starliner astronauts have returned to Earth after nine long months stuck in space—but their $150,000 salary won’t come with overtime
item.description: In comparison, bankers in New York make an average of $111,000 annually, without the risk of being exposed to an indefinite stay in dark, noiseless, u...

item.title: Why Goldman Sachs’ CIO is taking a measured approach to rolling out AI across the business
item.description: Half of the 46,000 employees at Goldman Sachs have access to AI, and CIO Marco Argenti expects more will tap into the technology this year.

item.title: U.S. stocks haven’t fallen this much between Fed meetings since 2022
